title: Who was your first champion?
body:
I started playing League of Legends a few years ago. I would still say I have a lot to learn about the game but, I totally love that! When I first started the first champion I ever played was {{champion:22}} and even though I was totally terrible my friends were soooo impressed by the fact that I would land all my Ashe arrows. I eventually moved on to using {{champion:1}} for most of my leveling experience. 

I still play Ashe as my main ADC champ and I am probably most comfortable playing here. (I get some sick ults with that chica)
I did find that after there was some changes to Annie I had a harder time playing her. I still sometimes drop my W as if it weren't connected to her. 

Who was your first champion in league? Have you stuck with them still? If you started over as a new player do you think you would still want to pick the same champ!?

replies.body:
My first champion was {{champion:1}} . I played her almost exclusively until 30. I dropped her for {{champion:99}}, at least as far as mid lane goes. I swapped over to being a support main in season three and picked up {{champion:37}}, and later {{champion:267}} . 

If I had to start over, I probably would have picked someone with a shield / heal, 'cause let's be honest, I was terrible and needed all the help I could get. xD

I struggled with Annie for a while. There was a short time where she was a support of choice and that was pretty cool.  I moved into and felt more comfortable with the support role and also followed up with {{champion:37}}  and {{champion:267}} . I heard my friends talking about {{champion:89}} in Skype and I decided to try her out.  Somehow everything I had learned up until that point just clicked and I haven't looked back! :)

{{champion:37}} My first champion was Sona of course.  I joined LoL to play her and she's the only champion I wanted to play for a very long time.  I stuck with her up until the nerfs 2 months ago.  Now I'm saddened having to abandon her to the same fate Lestara met.  I find myself playing many other champions instead now, like Ahri.
{{champion:103}}

No need to abandon {{champion:37}}, she's still great (also my first major IP investment way back when). I mean, when I can still zone out a {{champion:96}} + {{champion:412}} bot on my own, I'm not having any issues at least :p
That's not to say it wouldn't be good to branch out and play other champs too.

Aside from that, I've always been a major {{champion:72}} aficionado since he was released, and he's a big reason why I'm  favouring support AND jungle to this day.

Nope, Riot decided 12 weeks ago they want their playerbase to abandon Sona and they've succeeded.  My massive amount of playtime on her pre-nerf won't change cold hard fact.  Only Ezreal and Shurelia can save her now, but I can only assume they've been locked away deep within the Institute of War in chambers next to Fiddlestick's.

Institue of War? Sorry, it was wiped out from the lore, so...

I'm not saying Sona is in perfect shape, but she's certainly not the current Cassiopeia level of gone.

I only played Cass on Treeline and not since her targeted Treeline nerfs, so I'm not going to arrogantly assume I have any place to judge where she sits power-wise.  However, based on your profile you don't play either champion ever, or solo queue at all for that matter.

Having said that, the difference is that with Cassiopia Riot is at least making token attempts at buffing her, as seen with the increased base mana, mana/lvl and Q scaling she's receiving.  Whereas Sona has been in this sorry state for 12 whole weeks.  During the initial 4 weeks on PBE, she received both blatant nerfs as well as trade-offs that ultimately resulted as nerfs as well.  Since hitting live, not a single thing has changed other than "bugs" nerfing her Q range by up to -150 units.  The -50 range bug that's been around all 12 weeks and the new -100 range bug that appeared in patch 4.16.

Point being, the team working on Cass is putting in effort, whereas the Sona rework team never cared from the beginning and immediately abandoned her after being rushed to live, contrary to a promised extended time on PBE.

Sona is sitting on a +50% win rate in all ranked queues except challenger (and trying to pull meaningfull statistics out of a sample size of 200 is foolhardy). She is easily the most powerfull late game team fight support. They are fixing the unintentional range nerf in .17. Do you want sona to be "the best" support and crowd out everyone else? because they would nerf her just like everyone else who sat on top for too long.

Oh we're back to the win rate propaganda again?  Well Fiora is sitting at over 54% win rate.  Fiora must be broken OP, nerf Fiora.

She's not "the most powerful" anything, all of her abilities fall off comparatively in the late game to her previous abilities.  Her abilities lost indirect scaling, their base/rank numbers have been decreased and she has longer cooldowns/higher mana costs/melee range non-auras holding her back if either of those weren't enough.  If she really is this false almighty deity you make her out to be and since Fearless himself finally admitted she was stronger before the rework, that must mean that she was the undisputed #1 champion of the League with Titan-level strength surpassing any other god-like being, the uncontested pick for all 5 roles.  Every person here knows that wasn't the case.

Nobody's asking for her to be "the best" support, that's just your libel.  Personally, I would be satisfied if she was merely up to par with her old niche.  In her current form, she's not even a playable character.

Fiora is getting nerfs don't worry your head about that. and she is most definetly the best support late game because she gives basically the entirety of her buffs to all players on her team. of course the numbers aren't as good as lulu's because she buffs only 1 person.

I don't understand why you choose to hate Sona and defend a failed update that the lead designer of said project himself admitted to have been flawed, but by doing so I can officially consider you an Anti-Sona Cultist.
ok

Heh, I didn't mean I play them exclusively, I play lots of champs (and I play ranked mostly to just hit gold and get the rewards, usually TT since it's fast and easy, so those stats are what they are), but I tend to play Sona every once in a while pre-rework and post-rework, from since I started playing the game some years back. And I know my own experiences aren't statistical fact, but she didn't feel significantly weaker or stronger to me after the rework, just a bit different. The Q range change *is* annoying however. 

Cassi is getting some love, which is good for her since her current state didn't feel up to par from the games I tried after the rework (there are good ideas, but the numbers just make her a liability to her team). I think I've played Cass a couple of times in TT way back when, though not after the rework, don't know how she fares there now. Prolly not very well.

...that Sona pic, though XD

EDIT: p.s. I certainly didn't mean to come off arrogant in my previous post or this one. Sorry if I offended.

Well, weve all been with Ashe for the tutorial, the dirty hooe...


But my first was Nocturne, it was 2 weeks after he had been released, so, he was damn well brokenly OP. Good times. Funny thing is though, had no idea how to use his ult. I would press r then right click and nothing would happen, had no idea i had to press r a second time for the targeting to appear. 

Took me like 15 games and a Twisted fate video to figure it out.

I started with {{champion:29}} back in season 3, I think. He was a pretty solid ADC back then, dishing out 20-30 kills in a game. Still love him, but the thrill of playing a pure ADC has mostly worn off for me. These days I main {{champion:14}} Toplane or {{champion:54}} Support. Love that post-6 feeling of being at the absolute center of a teamfight and tanking everything.

When i started i was into boysh girls and big swords, and Riven was free :D

... i sucked. hard.

Then i fell in love with Veigar {{champion:45}} , he became my first champion uncloked and had a long run since!

The first champion that I played was Garen {{champion:86}} .  Played him and Kha`zix {{champion:121}}  quite a bit to try and get used to the game in the first two weeks.  The first champion that I bought was Twisted Fate {{champion:4}} .  He's just so fun to play. : )

For me it was {{champion:22}}  Ashe the Frost Archer for a very long time. I then started playing as a bunch of other champions that I really liked playing as as well, including but not limited to {{champion:110}}  Varus (I actually had a no death game of ARAM playing as him one time as well, thanks in part to my teammates there of course) , {{champion:90}} Malzahar and {{champion:37}} Sona as well as {{champion:34}} Anivia too as well just to name a few of the champions here and there.

Twisted Fate {{champion:4}}... i love cards... but was never good with him.. .:D next ones were udyr and rammus right after... {{champion:33}} (stilll pre-30) {{champion:77}} and i stuck to jungling since then... :){{item:1039}} {{summoner:11}}

1. First champ {{champion:1}}  when I reached 30 went too {{champion:4}}  but now i main top more then mid playing {{champion:59}}  and {{champion:62}} my mid laners being {{champion:238}} {{champion:55}} {{champion:43}}

{{champion:238}} .

Was so bad at him, I daren't remember it.

Next came {{champion:13}}  mid. I soon found out that ryze is ill equipped to deal with annie and miss fortune, the 2 most common midlanes i faced at those early levels.

First champ I was actually good at was {{champion:75}} Got 200+ stacks in my first game( vs players), before I knew that last hitting a creep was what gave you gold.
{{champion:96}} in a 1v1 vs Nikkone on {{Champion:28}}

I remember my first champion (Outside of the tutorials) being Twisted Fate{{champion:4}} : In fact, seeing the Twist of Fate Cinematic and knowing that he'd be on that particular week's free rotation is what made me start up, I feel. (Long story short, when your initials are ACE, you might grow a tendency towards card themes).

It's a bit of a shame too, because I haven't played him as much recently, college classes kicking my a** being a factor in me not playing as much recently in general. Maybe just because I don't play mid much, or I found myself forced into support a lot early on, so Lulu ended up being the champ I grew more experienced with.

Mine was Mundo.  I still play him from time to time, but usually as a non-meta Mid or Support.  I think Mundo has quite a bit of personality, and he was a pretty good champion to learn basic league mechanics with.

Ryze was my champion of choice in the tutorial, and actually remains one of the only laners I can actually play semi-decently.

Kayle was the first champion I bought with IP (shortly followed by Sivir), but I don't really play them anymore. I did essentially main Kayle until around level 25, tho, at which point I realized that I was a jungler at heart.

The first champ that I genuinely enjoyed playing (and actually played correctly!) was Katarina. I had bought a few others before her, but really had no idea how to use them, I.E. playing Nasus on mid lane and really having no order in what I bought (just got whatever seemed cool, or what I needed). I seem to remember thinking that ability power made all you're abilities stronger....silly level 5 me back then :)

My first was {{champion:75}} ... I saw this guy and {{champion:32}} and figured I'd make a theme of it and try to play as the Egypt inspired champs, even used to have the double lazer pyramids summoner icon set (until the friend that introduced the game to me IRL finally got on my friends list and I saw that he picked the same one, I had to change it to feel original heh)

Hilariously, having never played a MOBA prior to this one, I HATED being Nasus and abandoned the whole egypt champ idea because I didn't understand what last hits were yet.

I've started playing pre season 1. My first champ was {{champion:55}}. I read about all the champions available  back then, but this one seemed so different. FAST gameplay and no mana sounded awesome and boy was I happy with that purchase. Her ultimate used to be max damage on 1/2/3 targets, depending on skill level... :D

I used to play her A LOT. Over the past years I must have played like 2000 games with her...
I still play her :P

My first champion that I locked in as was Kayle, and I had no idea who she was or what she did, or even the fact that she was a she....

My first champion I played exclusively or mained was Gangplank. {{champion:41}} 

Bare in mind, this was season 1, when Gangplank still had the ability to deny minions and I thought that was just hilarious. Playing mid GP and denying every siege minion put your lane opponent at a huge EXP disadvantage .

My friends who started before me told me he was a trash tier champ and had nothing to offer. I saw otherwise, I mean come on! He's a pirate! How can a pirate not be awesome?

I still play him to this day, not exclusively, but he's still one of my go-to top laners because his global presence is unmatched.

Still playing {{champion:31}} to this day and I never get sick of him! You just can't beat the feeling of being larger than everyone in the game at level 16 with 6 stacks.
My first two champs were {{champion:24}} and {{champion:101}}

The first champion I mained was {{champion:127}} , though I got {{champion:67}} around the same time (I thought she had such a cool lore but then I learnt about the "Vayne players" and I was like "nope, don't want to be one of those people" so I never touched her again).
{{champion:18}}  in those days I treated the 2.5 attack speed cap as my personal goal every game.

the good ole days. I remember me and {{champion:9}} use to hang out alot, but then I grew to level 20, and from 20-30 it was ALL ABOUT THE CAIN {{champion:75}} . Which lead to my second favorite champ Karma, who I mained as a supp until I could afford {{champion:89}}.
First Champion I tried playing was {{champion:121}}, but the first champion I unlocked was {{champion:30}} after nearly losing a game to him as a bot.

My first champion was {{champion:10}}(I didn't count {{champion:22}} and {{champion:86}} from tutorials :D), before then she was nerfed to the ground. I still play her as support and I don't suck :P

My main champions are:
{{champion:60}}, {{champion:28}} and {{champion:102}} as jungler,
{{champion:89}}, {{champion:10}} and {{champion:25}} as support,
{{champion:18}} as ADC.
I don't play mid or top, I suck as mid or top :/

My first champion was also {{champion:22}} , and continues to be one of my favorite AD carrys with her being my first. After I played Ashe for a while I ended up playing some AD {{champion:1}}  (BTW she sucks really bad, talk about noob) then eventually getting 30 with AP Annie, {{champion:157}} , {{champion:254}} , and {{champion:117}}.

Someone told me to play {{champion:84}} and I ended up playing her for months on end. I still {{champion:5}} when I can cos I still enjoy playing him but most of the time its {{champion:55}} or {{champion:84}}!
Ahri in pvp i got rekt so hard
The first champ I actually unlocked was Lux, followed soon after by Ahri. I still play and enjoy both to this day; they're basically my go-to midlaners.

I first played as {{champion:39}}  just at the beginning of the Draaaaaaaaaven {{champion:119}} patch because she was a free week pick, still remember facing {{champion:122}}  as my first lane opponent...and getting bodied XD

Though I rarely play her anymore, I do alright  and still hate fighting {{champion:122}}  no matter what champ I am that game. And honestly looking back, I still probably would have chosen her over the others available, as tough as she was to learn.

I knew nothing. Me and LoL were nothing. I just got the one guy that was cheap and looked cool. {{champion:19}} was my first but he was so complicated at the time. I looked for another and ran into {{champion:77}} and he's been my main up until I hit level 30.
I started playing at around when {{champion:8}} My first champion I bought and have since mastered was {{champion:11}}

The first champ I ever played was {{champion:112}} , and found him absolutely beautiful, the skill cap was waaay out of my league but that's what I found great about him, and all the quotes and lore buffed up my appeal. The first champ I ever got was {{champion:9}} and that made me just love the idea of jumping onto people and doing tons of damage^. Several months and a few other champs later I finally got Vik again and have loved him ever sense <3.
